alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Buckingham; Campbell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Appomattox, northeastern Campbell, northeastern Bedford, southwestern Buckingham, and southeastern Amherst Counties and the City of Lynchburg through 345 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bent Creek to near Stonewall to near Sedalia. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lynchburg... Appomattox... Bent Creek... Concord... Forest... Rustburg... and Madison Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
